description.value:
Wanderers, regional wardens, or monster hunters. Rangers easily circumvent obstacles and have magical powers they draw from nature or powerful honed instincts.

The following is a revision of the 5e ranger class, meant to address their lack of damage scaling and improve or replace abilities that were too weak or too situational. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the ranger class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#ranger]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Rangers

When you create a level 1 Ranger, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 10 &reference[Dexterity]:16 &reference[Constitution]: 14 &reference[Intelligence]: 10 &reference[Wisdom]: 16 &reference[Charisma]: 8

or

Strength: 16 Dexterity:14 Constitution: 14 Intelligence: 9 Wisdom: 14 Charisma: 8

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per ranger level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: two, which can be either @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#crafting-tools]{Crafting Tools} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#exploration-tools]{Exploration Tools}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Strength], &Reference[Dexterity]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: &Reference[Survival], and three of: &Reference[Animal Handling], &Reference[Athletics], &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Investigation], &Reference[Medicine], &Reference[Nature], &Reference[Perception], &Reference[Stealth]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Languages}: one of your choice

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.QhHQy7whejLOVFf8]{scale mail} -OR- @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.jSi9ralAm7FzUQbH]{padded armor}
  • two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.0hIX4VFLMTXWVYoW]{shortswords} -OR- two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS#simple-melee-weapons]{Simple Melee Weapons} -OR- one @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El#martial-melee-weapons]{Martial Melee Weapons}
  • A @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.u9OIgbETWimkeEx5]{longbow} and 20 arrows
  • two sets of @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{tools}, which you gained proficiency with as part of the ranger class
  • a dungeoneer's pack -OR- an explorer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a ranger level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level rangers gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For rangers you must have:

  • EitherStrength: 14 orDexterity: 14

  • Wisdom: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per ranger level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: two, which can be either @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#crafting-tools]{Crafting Tools} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#exploration-tools]{Exploration Tools}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: &Reference[Survival], and one of: &Reference[Animal Handling], &Reference[Athletics], &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Investigation], &Reference[Medicine], &Reference[Nature], &Reference[Perception], &Reference[Stealth]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Languages}: one of your choice

Ranger Advancement

advancement.title: Fighting Style
advancement.hint: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options from the appropriate class list. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
Survival, and three of: Animal Handling, Athletics, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Stealth

advancement.title: Iron Resilience
advancement.hint: You gain proficiency in constitution and wisdom saving throws. If you already have one or both of these saving throw proficiencies, you may choose any other saving throw to become proficient in.

advancement.title: Expertise
advancement.hint: Choose any two of your skills. You have expertise (you add double your proficiency bonus) with checks made with these skills.

advancement.title: Expertise
advancement.hint: Choose any two of your skills. You have expertise (you add double your proficiency bonus) with checks made with these skills.

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose two shortswords -OR- two Simple Melee Weapons -OR- one Martial Melee Weapon

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose two sets of tools, which you gained proficiency with as part of the ranger class

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 2nd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 3rd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 4th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 5th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats, ranger feats, and combat maneuver feats by default.
        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
        
        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.

advancement.title: Ranger Conclave
advancement.hint:
You choose a ranger conclave, which represents the specialized training and skills you develop that make you different from other rangers. Your conclave gives you new abilities at this level and at levels 3, 6, 11, and 14.
                
Ranger conclaves published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the ranger class. For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
